channel.title: Editing .RSCD files
channel.description:
Hey, Recently I have been busy playing around with xEnt's landscape editor,and tonight I was about to compress it with the Compression tool builded in RSCD V25,and it gave me this error:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: DefCompressor Caused by: Java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Defcompressor.
Ok,well.. This sounds very easy. It's not finding the Defcompressor,however it surely is there,together with all the rest of the files. The Java path's are good as I can compile,the same with apache 1.7.1
Now my two questions are:
Whenever I try to compress,it doesn't let me because of the error above. Whenever I try to login it doesn't show the things I updated,however it's getting stuck around the area's I putted walls in. (Very weird,because normally you have to compress first.)
The compressor worked before,but stopped working somehow lately :s
Anyone help please? :D
PS.
I tryed to use 7-zip,but I don't know how to use it. :( If someone cares to explain I would appreciate it ! :D

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

7-zip right click compress with 7-zip format G-zip and hit run if you get eror on that then gtfu:

Now my two questions are:

Whenever I try to compress,it doesn’t let me because of the error above.
Whenever I try to login it doesn’t show the things I updated,however it’s getting stuck around the area’s I putted walls in. (Very weird,because normally you have to compress first.)


Wheres the question tard?

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @PKERZ PKERZ
item.description:
@PKERZ wrote:

Why does it say “Defcompressor” with a lower-case “c”? Shouldn’t it perhaps be an upper-case “C”, as in “DefCompressor”?

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @Godandjesus Godandjesus
item.description:
@Godandjesus wrote:

[quote="``Mark, post:4, topic:280572"]Still the same error.
Could not find the main class: Defcompressor. Program will exit.
However,it’s still in the same folder lol

Now I am gonna try the .RSCD thing

Still nothing.
I edit it,then the changes aren’t on the server.
How come it doesn’t ? :S[/quote]

Remember son client and server side.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @_Mark ``Mark
item.description:
@_Mark wrote:

Still the same error.
Could not find the main class: Defcompressor. Program will exit.
However,it’s still in the same folder lol

Now I am gonna try the .RSCD thing

Still nothing.
I edit it,then the changes aren’t on the server.
How come it doesn’t ? :S

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Don’t use the Compress All batch file. There should be a batch file called Run with:

@echo off java DefCompressor compress all pause
Inside of it. That’s the one you use to compress files (XML files).

The Landscape.rscd doesn’t need to be compressed.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .RSCD files
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

You don’t need to compress/decompress the Landscapes.rscd file. Just copy and paste the edited one client and server side.

Read full topic

item.description:

Hey,
Recently I have been busy playing around with xEnt’s landscape editor,and tonight I was about to compress it with the Compression tool builded in RSCD V25,and it gave me this error:
